fnSjUbJyKWP9gUc6gv_i3Q.text: Love this place, hate the fact that is halfway across the country.  A definite must for beer enthusiasts.  The best selection I have seen anywhere, they have a True variety and not just a few imports.  I am a lover of Belgian Beer, and this place really hits the spot. They have an excellent selection both on tap and in bottle, though the bottle selection is larger.  Much like wine the various styles of beer have a specific glass.  Some places fail to realizes this, but not Sharp Edge.  The beer alone makes it, but the atmosphere is just the cherry on top.  Wonderful, classy, and relaxing atmosphere.  Not at all a dive, or even some swanky nose in the air joint.  Just a nice friendly place to sit back and enjoy some brew.  The food is split between typical bar fair, and honest to goodness entrees.

xNo4i9YekogpwcrnnBfdoA.text: I ordered the mussels cooked in beer broth with leeks and tomatoes along with a side of Belgian fritted.  There was absolutely zero broth with the mussels, very few leeks, and pale mealy tomatoes.  The frittes were plain old fries a little browner in color due to spices that I couldn't taste, and they needed salt.  There was mustard to dip them in.  The Palm beer I ordered was excellent but the food was "meh" at best.  Go for the beer but dine elsewhere.

e4jQRYOsD8uJnR9EJieIeA.text: One of the best places in the burg to get great beer. I'm a big fan of teh Troubador. The food is pricy, as well as the beer but you defentialy get a good product.  Get there during happy hour and look for M. Kail.  Great place to go in the middle of the day during the winter to catch a buzz.

tHrSPYktJmg8rDltWosZiw.text: a tad on the pricey side, but the beer selection is TOTALLY worth the trip...and the bill. (employees are always incredibly knowledgeable about the beers, too.)

It3oCbknf4pX-EkHNCSpDg.text: My GF and I go to the Sharp Edge Creekhouse pretty regularly. We play trivia there on Sunday evenings. We usually get the Field Green salads with the Raspberry house-made dressing - it's made with framboise and it's amaing. My fav is the flatbread pizzas. The jerked BBQ chicken pizza is my favorite. Sharp Edge has an world-class beer selection. I knocked-off a star for service. Some nights the service is excellente. Some nights it is awful. I don't know if it's kitchen or wait staff to blame. But, more times than not, they don't have enough servers on-duty for an unexpected crowd. The trivia night is a lot of fun though. The trivia host, Mark, does a great job. Sharp Edge Creekhouse is a lot of fun, great atmosphere if you like a ski lodge, laid back vibe.

QwOxQbJHJlPqpdPV9DKlRg.text: Boneless wings fries and beer what else could you want. Great beer selection, and nice beer baskets around the holidays. Food is consistently good, chicken club grinder is awesome. reasonably priced, can be loud.

F62LacBGJ6EFwFf0Zm-a_A.text: I have been to this location twice recently - once of lunch and once for dinner - honestly I would say skip it. The service at lunch was extremely slow - I was there with a coworker - we both got sandwiches (one of which was not prepared the way that we asked for it) and it took almost 45 to an hour to get food with the place empty with the exception of two other people. I went for dinner to give it another shot - first strike was that the draft list wasn't up to date (or even close) and the server didn't even know what was on draft - you are a place that specializes in beer - know your products to be able to sell them. The food is just ok - nothing bad but nothing I couldn't live without. I guess what bothers me the most about both visits is that the service has been subpar at best. Prior to the last 5-6 years I would have said that Sharp Edge would be one of the better beer selections in the city - now there are plenty of other places you can find a great selection of beer with better atmosphere and service.

3m6ovF_EbZbB3QncbJCoiQ.text: Great food, excellent beer selection, good service, excellent (fun and classy inside or fun and relaxing outside) ambiance.

GAPvV7nvgVZvkGyn-uVdVA.text: I have a soft spot in my heart for the Creekhouse. The draught selection and attention to detail with beer can rarely be beat anywhere. If you are looking for Belgians (beer, not people) then i can't  imagine anywhere better but perhaps Brugge itself.  I would give it 5 stars, but the food is often not good and is overpriced. Their 'belgian fries' are not even close, sorry.  Go for the amazing beer selection, you will never be dissappointed.

U-AHWVXJz5NmUVHkQ9LAXg.text: The beer selection is unbelievable and the prices aren't terrible as they are a little lower than some of the other Sharp Edge locations. Try the pizza for a solid yet inexpensive meal.

wE4pmd1twNYIxg2JlBGTiQ.text: i hooked up with some friends from my childhood last year at a reunion. wow! people really don't change much! we fit back into our groove without hesitation. we decided to meet at least once a month for lunch, just us girls, no hubbies or boyfriends allowed! we even have a name for our group-the carlynton cougars club!!! yeah, we went to carlynton, wanna make something about it??? & yeah, we're over the hill "cougars"! this month, unfortunately only 3 of us could get together. we went to the sharpedge creekhouse. when i went inside, it was a dark bar, we decided to sit outside on the deck. while waiting ruth to arrive, marty & i placed an order for the belgian croquettes to see what they were.  they were log shaped, fried & tasted like instant mashed potatoes with a hint of cheese. the dip seemed like it was ranch dressing. a far cry from what the menu said-mashed yukon gold potatoes with swiss & asiago cheeses served with herbed aioli. oh no, did we pick the wrong place? the menu is pretty extensive. they have a little of everything. i was impressed with the selection of burgers you could choose from. besides your normal beef burger, they had venison, wild boar, buffalo & a belgian-a mix of lamb & sirloin. i ordered the salmon nicoise salad from the "feature menu", marty got the philly cheese steak wrap & ruth the deluxe salad with chicken. thank god! the food was way better than the appetizer!!! my nicoise was outstanding. the homemade dressing was delicious!!! even my roll was warm & soft! marty's wrap was enormous!!! 1/2 of it was more than a meal, & there were fries that came with it! ruth's salad looked as yummy as mine. (i had considered it only with portabello mushrooms, but i'm glad i got the nicoise!) we're planning on where to go in october. any suggestions??? we'll be at the roller derby, i know that much! go steel city girlz!!!

lVsGTiA5tpcX_iN6iy-izA.text: Fool me once, shame on you.  Fool me twice, shame on ME!  I had stopped in to this place with friends to have a drink, and despite being a little put off by the servers, I came back because they usually have a really nice selection of beers.  My first mistake was to order anything from the kitchen.  My second mistake was to take my wife there and meet with some friends, and order something from the kitchen.  Bottom line - the kitchen, the people who plan the menu, the wait staff, and probably the kitchen manager are basically clueless about food and food service.  If you want to try an unusual beer that you have never tried before (beware, some of them are pretty nasty and they no longer seem to want to give you a "sample" cup before you order) and you don't mind spending a LOT of money for an unusual beer, by all means stop by and check out.  Just do yourself a favor and don't come hungry!

Zn3lodQY9O24JUr3IqXW5Q.text: Fantastic, Fantastic, Fantastic. You need to come and check this place out. That's it.  I enjoyed the French Onion soup, black and blue burger and have come here with co-workers for a few pints after a long day in the office. Highly recommend.

naep6ie8SzeN4GxU-d_Vmg.text: This place screwed me on the on the check and refused to do anything to take care of it. I have never in my history of dining out been to a place that did that and didn't care about their customers.

h8e2Ie0UWu5mVwwL9ZSjJQ.text: Beer is awesome, but food can be hit or miss and is definately too pricey for the taste. Needs some lighter menu choices too. However, go for the Belgium imports!!!!

9x-wY_aVoJKiof-fV_QR8w.text: Beer selection is second to none. Had the Piggy Bac Burger (ground pork with bacon) and it was outstanding.

zDcJEUaeRkh_FQ6IYavuMw.text: An ungodly amount and variety of beer. Belgians are the specialty but there's soooooo much more. Imports. American Crafts. Authentic glassware. Good food. Half price happy hours (!!!). Sharp Edge simply ROCKS.

92sk_wRLezhlRphAAk6N4Q.text: "Where to Find the Best Belgian Beer Bar in North America".  Well, I can't comment on that because I'm a non-drinker.  I was out in Crafton doing a site visit for work and thought I'd stop in here for some lunch.  I have to say I love the building this place is in.  It does look like an old creekhouse.  I've been by this place before and I'm pretty sure it's been other things.    So I sat myself down, opened the menu, and --yow!-- the prices here are a little steeper than I thought they might be!  Oh well, it was getting past lunchtime and Susan's tummy was talking to her!  I was looking at the appetizers and I saw the Belgian Pomme Frites.  Yikes!  That thing probably could feed five.  I was also thinking about some soup and I noticed the Hop Devil Potato.  "Creamy cheddar cheese soup spiked with Victory Hop Devil (whatever that is), loaded with tender potatoes and served in a sourdough bread bowl."  That's not just soup, that's a meal!  For two, it seems!    So I went for the Rueben, figuring that wouldn't be so ginormous and even if it was, I could get half to go.  It didn't disappoint and I did end up taking half of it with me.  My sandwich was good though.  I give Sharp Edge a solid three stars because:  Pro:  Excellent atmosphere in a pretty building. Semi Pro:  Food is good, but it's typical bar fare. Con:  Kind of pricey.

sGET5K880M4Dw0wVvnR2eA.text: Here is my second bad review I have written and oddly enough it for another Sharpe Edge location.  See my review of the Brasserie  in Peters Township to learn of that most embarrassing situation.   I have been a fan of the Sharp Edge since the mid 1980s when my friend Scott and I went almost weekly for about 5 years and enjoyed tasting what was at that time the only wide ranging beer taps in Pittsburgh.  In the past year I have had bad experiences at three different Sharp Edge locations.  In this review I will only discuss the extremely embarrassing situation at the Creekhouse.  Wow what a mess this was.  First, the server never came around, often waiting 15 minutes for him to acknowledge our existence.  Interesting that the manager finally started waiting on when we complained, but he was no better.   I ordered an appetizer for my wife since she was coming from work and asked for it to be made immediately. After another 15 minute wait he stopped by again and asked if we wanted the appetizer to go in????  We were waiting insufferably long to get our drinks refilled and quite frankly, ignored.   Of course they also have the NEW policy of no samples for beer.  Another reason o go elsewhere for your $8.00 beer.    My friend had called around 4:30PM to learn if there was a lenten fish special, the person on the phone told about the $11.99 Friday Fish special.  When we got there we learned from the manager that the special was only for lunch and that we would be paying $15.99 for the fish.  He went on to tell us that "no one would have told you that the special was $11.99 for dinner".   I truly enjoy being called a liar by the manager in front of friends.    We paid our bill and left and went up the road on 60 to Butyas where the fish sandwich was huge and delicious and the server was awesome!   By the way, no one called us liars there either!      A quick note on their food.  I have never been a fan of their food except for the white pizza.  In recent years they have industrialized their food, pre-making it in a central kitchen.  It is substandard even by basic bar food standards and   it is EXTREMELY overpriced.   Sorry Sharp Edge, no more second (third) chances.

z-cLzkV6GTl77I3B0C4Ftw.text: I thought it was delicious the burger was kind of burnt but i loved it!  I like knowing my burger is really well done.  It was expensive but I left very full.  The cost of the beer was generally what you pay pretty much everywhere in Pittsburgh.  I would go back though.

EBW1gutZaI8_J4Mc102v0w.text: I live so close, I wanted this place be awesome and... it's just okay.  The beer selection is great, really Great! The bartenders know what their serving, and have great knowledge of whats new and even how many years a brewery may have made said beer. Kudos on that. I admit I'm a bit of a beer snob, but when my wife and I go out its gonna take more than a great beer selection to keep us coming back. With menu selections to the likes of Elk and other fine ingredients you'd think the food would be better. Honesty if you're gonna have it, give it some justice. Or like another yelper mentioned slim down your menu and do it very well... ... P.S. after having drunk a Pumpkin ale that had soured, for their July "mystery beer". I'll forever steer clear of the mystery, but will probably walk down from time to time to catch a buzz.

rQL7ubtCCmUpz5mDTpMBAw.text: So the first time I went to this restaurant my sister told me "Kate, I found this awesome GREEK spot we should try!" haha. At least she is pretty...  So I have been here twice. The first time was mediocre but the second time is a bit more fresh in my mind.   I love beer! I wish I didn't love beer so much but I have tried to not drink on mondays so this is a "non-drinking review", for once.   It was gorgeous on monday so we decided to sit outside on their patio with a beautiful view of an underpass...(its pittsburgh not Maui, I understand)   Service was a little spotty in even though we had two servers but it was a beautiful night and we weren't in a rush. I am always trying to eat healthy (summer is coming) but this was challenging at this spot. I ended up with the mediterranean ground chicken burger with feta and a salad. Pretty good (I ate the whole thing) but something was a little off. I don't think I would get it again.  Something about their menu intrigues me but there is always some that throws off an option for me. I think if I go back I might switch to drinking my dinner here.  PRO: Outdoor seating, beer list, friendly service (although spotty)  CON: Limited wine list, menu kinda misses with me, not many healthy options, strange lingering creek smell, spotty service, not a cheap bill when we all just got sandwiches  Overall: Might go back for light apps and drinks not dinner tho

cjeKKGBT9307rmpmkx00BQ.text: Huge beer selection available, both on tap and bottled. You can also make a beer basket to take as a gift. You have the option of typical bar food with a Belgian flare. With multiple locations you can find good food throughout the Pittsburgh area.

rqtKq8Y-d77Wd6wt0h9O4g.text: This is a cool place with a great beer selection and it has a ton if potential to b a great spot - it's a bit pricey for it's out of date decor, filthy bathroom, and sticky tabletops.

MXuLQ-7B9ges7oxArFdYQA.text: Beer. Belgian Beer.  Okay, they have other beers too, but this is a Belgian Beer joint and likely one of the best around. The mussels are great and the pub-like atmosphere is super cool. This was previously a house turned into a restaurant bar.  It's really well done and serves the clientele very nicely.  Gotta stop in for the heavy and tasty Christmas brews. Pricey, but relatively good if you consider all the shipping receiving, stocking of this exquisite beer collection...

Wuh6rN4PKkrFne2AWTgbFg.text: We were looking for a good place to go for happy hour on a Friday when a friend suggested Sharp Edge Creekhouse. It might be my new favorite place! We were there for happy hour, which includes half priced beer. We tried a couple different Belgian imports and they were all delicious. I had the basil, garlic, and white wine mussels (which I have been craving since our visit) with a side of the pomme frites; my husband and friends all had pizza. The food was delicious, the beer was delicious, the prices were good, and the waitress was helpful and personable.

K0rn0BaWPZum_8FHohESLQ.text: My boyfriend and I went here on a Sunday night and we had a buy one get one coupon. I was able to get a salad, and he got a fish sandwich. The bartender was our server, and he was able to man the bar and tables. Everything was awesome. I am a very picky eater, and he was able to order the food for me the way that I wanted it.   We recently went back and sat on the patio hoping to get the same kind of service. When we presented another coupon, the waitress obviously wrote us off. The funny thing is, is that with a coupon we are better tippers! We were forced to order off of a limited (more expensive) menu. I asked to have my food cooked plain, without extra calories from dressing and sauce, and no matter what I tried to order, it could not be modified. I ended up getting the Mahi, which if I didn't need to watch my weight would have been delicious. However, with medical issues, I am unable to eat certain things. The waitress told me that it had to be cooked in the soy marinade, but on top of that, it was loaded with an alfredo/mayo kind of sauce. Talk about calories galore! I tihink that she told the chef to pile it on. I ate none of it.   The atmosphere is nice, and the beer list is okay if you like Belgium beers. They do not offer anything light except for Amstel Light. The server tonight had way too many tables, and seemed to focus on larger groups. We have decided to "write the restaurant off." We have both worked in the restaurant industry for many years, and we were dissapointed in the date night experience. If my meal wasn't half price, I would have sent it back, and I have never in my life complained about a meal.

-9C4ovMUmUp_D1pqdBrVZw.text: Last year my husband and I went on a date here and the food was very delicious. The waitress was awesome and still to this day when I come in with my cousin, she still remembers me and asks about my husband and our son. I don't think its possible that they could serve a bad dish. The choices of beers are impressive and the atmosphere is inviting and laid back. This place is one of those joints where you would being an out of town friend because it is just that great.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy Framboise Belgian Beer
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mediterranean Nachos

asqKoSQ3NZ2l4MmaCIjAZw.text: I have not been to this place in over 5 years until last night . It's a place that I think is easy to forget is there . You really need to know the area to find it . Known for it's huge beer selection . No dissapointment . 5 stars .The food is typical bar food with a few better enterees. 3 stars . The service  we had on the deck was top notch . The bar inside seems small but cozy . Great place to take a date and sit on deck and chat .

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kZl-qfXQucF7HwNAaachHA.text: Yeah, I didn't like the calamari either, but as a mussel-fanatic, I was very pleased with what Sharp Edge makes. Mine had curry in them and the bread soaked up the broth nicely. The mussels were good and tender. Oh my God, the Belgian Chocolate Pudding is soooooo delish! I also liked dining outside. Cool place to eat.

QvbE_2aR3auV1OxIri0mvA.text: Huge selection of beer from all over the world! We had their club and bbq chicken wraps which were really good. Burgers and pizza also looked good. Nice atmosphere and good specials. Wednesday is wing night!

cVW_v_rev6FC7SM0YaALuw.text: I love it here!  They have great boneless wings, pizza, salads and just about everything.  Brendon is the best bartender EVER!

FGO2saYzgA-_rAt5H1OOMw.text: I love having this bar in my backyard. Incredible food, incredible beer selection and a staff that is very educated in everything they have. Sometimes the back patio can have slow service when there is a game on and there is a unisex bathroom on the first floor. Other than that no complaints. Love it!

bdEgPW5j-akCCR9nOQ9hxA.text: Love this place! Most of the food is just kind of regular bar food ( Id suggest the honey jalapeno bites) but the batender Bennan is amazing and the beer selection is superb. If you want to try amazing beers this is the place to go.

aAWNG9igwcRC3P0VORlVMA.text: Great selection of beers except for light bears of which I believe they only had two.  prices for the beer seemed a bit high to me $12 and up for a bottle, but they do have a happy hour.  prices were also slightly steep for the food but the portions were nice sized, the burger while  a bit well done from what I ordered, was delicious. The very friendly waitress was overworked since she was the only one there to take care of every table. The biggest surprise was the calamari fries. lightly breaded, cooked to perfection and ,brace yourself, not rubbery. they were delicious and tender. While we can't afford to go there every week we'll definitely be stopping back.

NRwpb06gJRUCIJgpbVBsXA.text: They have a pretty good beer selection, as expected.  As for how to know what beer to select, that's a different story.   There was a dirty chalkboard with some listed beers using low-contrast colors, like blue on black.  We weren't even in the same room as the chalkboard, so it was doubly impractical to read.  So we asked our server what beers they had on tap.  Her answer: Go look at the tap handles.   Give me a break.  Aside from that incident, she was pretty inattentive overall.  The food menu indicated a special garlic section.   The shredded pork sandwich description invoked a vision of roasted garlic cloves spread thinly on the roll, and it would come with garlic frites.  Sounds delicious, right?   What I got was a pretty standard pork sandwich with a huge glop of garlic-flavored grainy-fake-cheese tasting paste.  And the frites?  Standard steak fries from a freezer bag with a huge glop of garlic-flavored grainy-fake-cheese tasting paste.

_fyVAIuDmJuBu6ofPF2OJA.text: Fantastic Belgian beer menu. This is my friend's local bar so I can't say anything bad about it. :) My turkey rueben and sweet potato fries were decent, nothing amazing or anything but good for bar food! A neat lil place - a good place for happy hour!

g4o2BQEgIU4wX50BxaoFag.text: The Sharpe Edge name is very fitting in that the drink options and specials are excellent, but the food is dull like the backside of a knife.   Having been numerous times I have come to appreciate that Belgian beers are so much more then too sweet beer I had tried at parties a couple of times.  And half off Belgian beers during happy hour is the perfect time for your own education!    OTOH, I can't think of a single thing on the menu to compliment.  Even the french fries leave me disappointed, looking nicely browned, but then somehow managing to be limp and lame.  The pizza should just be removed from the menu entirely or at least renamed so it is not confused with real pizza.  Cut the menu down by half and focus on making the best bar food in town that can live up to the great staff and beer selection.  Thanks

RxudzTtiYdkdWT2-fF5CnQ.text: This place is close to my house and a friend of mine suggested that I give it a try. Gotta say that I have never had a bad experience here. My food always comes out the way I want it. The make your own burgers are always done right and the bread that it comes on is delicious. I've read the negative reviews and can honestly say I've never had an issue with the service.  As for the food, I'm a big foodie and not a fan of subpar food and this place always satisfies me. Some reviews say that the food here is bland, the only way I can see that happening is if you order something and tell them you don't want all the things that come with it.

_LwbEHZaf2yE1KBcAoMtNA.text: Very very large  beer selection bottled and draft.  Bartender was great with explaining the beers they have. Great prices on happy hour with a good food selection.  Try a different wild game burger if you're adventurous!

3QzoyD-LLarQEFZ7cmUI7Q.text: Pretty simple review here.  Go for the Beer, not the food.  The food was just okay. The wings were good but my burger, asked for medium was well done and burnt.  If I went again it would just be for beer and apps.   Service was fast but they did not look really busy, our waiter was really nice.

8SwP52BYvr3srLgEGsA3RQ.text: I work local to the Creekhouse, so I thought I'd give it a try for lunch.  I called in my order and told it would be ready in 15 minutes.  I gave them 20 and still had to wait another 15 minutes for the food.  I didn't check the bag (I know dumb on my part).  I ordered sliders.  2 were over cooked to the point of being burnt around the edges.  The other was not even a burger!  It was 2 small pieces of meat rolled into balls and barely cooked.  There was no mustard or mayo as stated on the menu, just some ketchup packets in the bottom of the bag.  The rest of the order was okay........but then again it's pretty hard to mess up food that just needs to be deep-fried.

ffUXPFIW-Gplg8ClsDP7Ew.text: I went here for the first time last night to visit a friend who bar tends. I absolutely loved it! From the moment I got out of my car I thought "This is a cool looking building" and inside it has a nice, homey feel to it. It looks like it may have even been an old home at one time? The building inside & out has a lot of character. If you are looking to have a night out away from the typical , over crowded, grungy bars this is the place to go! Great food and very large drink variety too!

1HOnbH9xz6IVEyrl4X_eHQ.text: I don't like anything about this place - the food is TERRIBLE & overpriced. The beers are way too expensive compared to other pubs. The service is awful & the building is a dirty old house. I've had several issues with the management as well. They just don't know what they are doing.

a0bdwk4kvKPSXCc6IwGeIg.text: Decent beer selection but the beer tastes like the taps are dirty I've tried different beers on multiple occasions with the same weird taste. I've had drinks at the penn ave location with no issues.

6GRO6Pr6n4UReFyoscgfMA.text: Ran across this place on a business trip, we arrived early and were hungry so we stopped in for lunch before out nearby appointment. Had the club such was a bit dry but very delicious. The bar is what really caught my attention, looked very interesting, must have been at least 40 tap handles, all craft and import beers. The menu had a nightly British set course special that included a 3 glass beer pairing. I found myself hoping to come back on another visit to the area at dinner time. Definitely looks like a beer-loves favorite hang out. I have got to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

B5KhSFL88DTVT8TBK3iEXw.text: Beer selection is good, however beer was not cold. Ordered fish sandwich as the menu listed it as a favorite. Fish tasted like it came from a frozen bag and just deep fried. More than likely won't be making a second trip back.

V4qHvuzRKt79dPNTdjHmKw.text: The Sharp Edge Creekhouse was one of the first local places I tried since i moved to Pittsburgh over a year ago and has been the preferred lunch spot during the workday.  As this place is renowned for its selection of Belgian beers, it balances a nice variety on the menu of typical bar food with a touch of flair.  My personal favorite is the Venison Cheeseburger that makes any 3 hour morning sales meeting seem worth it.  Sharp Edge has daily specials and I personally get giddy over the pierogies and sausage.  A typical favorite through these snowy days is the soup salad combo with cup of Irish coffee.    Overall the service is good, the staff are nice and i haven't had a bad experience.  There is a covered deck for outdoor dining and an upstairs dining room for those busy nights.  As for the beer selection...let me just say that i make it a point to bring all my hopheads and beer junkies to Sharp Edge simply for the selection and to talk beer.

qK9dt8COhZyqhuk-hhnCAA.text: I keep trying to give Sharp Edge the benefit of the doubt, but I have to say, I've been let down every single time. This particular location might be the worst of the bunch. Their tap lines are dirty, the employees are rude, and they're out of all the beers on the menu (although since they haven't updated the menu since mid-September, I can see how that would happen.) Bottom line: overpriced, bad service, shitty beer.

VuYcc--2QhKl_er8ZRzfCw.text: Had the half Ruben sandwich with homemade fries for launch. Sandwich was great fries were a bit on the oily side. Went during Monday lunch hours - had one person waiting on everyone so you have to wait a bit to place your order or to get the check.

gy79vVhB7LZGlFFvmFy2BA.text: The burgers are one of a kind there.  Excellent attention to detail in preparation of the food.  Service was prompt and professional.  A great place for a splurge meal or anniversary as it it sorta expensive, but worth it for the quality.

FIHg5bTe3L9LfZ2mjl6YDg.text: Went few times in Creek house and I've got German wheat beer . Omg! The best beer I have ever tried . They also have food menu , pretty good sandwiches ! Recommend

1vJIMaey770qeK7affhCNA.text: i LOVE sharp edge creekhouse!  we are there almost every friday after work, and we've never been let down.  We've had 1 or 2 minor things go wrong with an order, but it's not even worth mentioning because it's always immediately taken care of above and beyond expectation.  The food is I would say, just average, but we love going there because they have a great beer selection and we always feel so welcome and taken care of when we show up.  The staff is so friendly, and so knowledgable.. these people know their beer!  Their late night menu is decent.  They have a bunch of half price appetizers, and have a limited selection of full price items as well (it's basically the entire menu excluding soups and salads).  The prices are good and we always leave satisfied :)

IBhp6j-V_c1I4mHqS21mCA.text: Huge beer selection that they are famous for, and the staff are always friendly helpful and attentive. Definitely one of my go-to places! The HTB burger and sweet potato fries are awesome you won't be sorry if you stop by.

g8-7uazK3dtluNEwp9Nkqw.text: Great place for happy hour or a casual dinner when you want to have a beer-  The Sharp Edge is where I take friends that want a good beer selection and a casual atmosphere.    My favorite menu item is the Belgian burger which is a lamb burger (juicier and more delicate than beef) with their great mustard and traditional fixings.  The buffalo bites are a solid appetizer as well as the sweet potato fries.  The beer selection is what will bring you back to this restaurant.  The menu is pretty pedestrian, prices are about $1 too expensive for what you get compared to other places of the same quality (but if you go during happy hour and get half off your beer, it all evens out).  There are burgers, sandwhiches, paninis, pizza and a few entrees.  My mother who has a limited view of food thought there were some strange things, but I didn't find anything I would consider strange.  Service is typically average, but they know their beers well and will help you find a new beer you will like.

OWJgt6XNG65x38E48RwHpg.text: Must tell you first that we are a customer at this place in the summer time only.  That is because we enjoy sitting on the deck and having a mid day lunch with a couple of cold beers.  We've tried a lot of the menu and enjoy most everything we've tasted.  Not sure I'd order the mussels with the blue cheese and black pepper again, but they were all eaten.  Our youngest son gives it a "thumbs up" and he's a tough customer and tough reviewer of a burger.  He's a fan and our family likes the deck at this friendly stop.

f2FaBX8n9BptbUVT4vcQ3A.text: Excellent beer and delicious food! I had the garlic basil white wine mussels, salad with house dressing (which is their own recipe and Deeeeeeelish!) And Alex had the Belgian burger along with a couple different beer selections. Our server was really sweet and made sure my soda was never empty. We love this place!

LSIrUfAoTBsjpcDsR-lsyQ.text: Fav local spot for good beer, comfy atmosphere, and great food! Occasionally they get a little too busy and don't have much staff, so service takes a little longer. But if you're enjoying a drink, it won't even be a big deal. Really cute place!

iGuCLZJrzFhacIbd1nzHGA.text: The worst Reuben I've ever eaten. No cheese, no dressing, and the sauerkraut had obviously just been dumped from the bag and was still dripping wet. The waitress also didn't check on us once the food was dropped off despite empty beer glasses. Huge disappointment and super overpriced for the crap food and service.

67xF2PUibt22m8VhP2gW2g.text: I used to live close to this place, and I never took advantage of its awesomeness.  It's a great place for happy hour and their menu is solid.  Their beer selection is phenomenal.  If you like imports and\or crafts then this is the place for you .... if you're looking for a Budweiser, then go to CPT Sucky Beers Pub and house of dookiebier.  If you want good food, great beer, and a groovy atmosphere .... come check it out.  They have a deck for summertime as well ..... which, I guess you could hang out on during the winter but that would just make your weird .... unless you're rich then eccentric.

BQP1ubzTSTRby7zXdx_jZA.text: They had a really good beer selection, slightly pricey, but not ridiculous.  Our waitress was really nice, but not that knowledgeable about the beer selection.    The food was not that great.  Don't get the Caesar salad, not sure where they were trying to go with the dressing, but it doesn't taste like Caesar.  The wings were pretty good.  I would go again if that's where everyone wanted to go, but it would not be my first choice.  If I went again, I would stick with just the fried food.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Honey BBQ wings
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mmmm beer

oovBeHYVMOHttVW305_tYg.text: Stopped there today. Waitress was beyond wonderful and very very knowledgeable about every beer they offered. I had the Buffalo burger which was very good .it's a must eat. The other 2 people with me had a different burger and a salad with boneless chicken bites on it. At the team they both loved their meals. Needless to say about an hour later they both got very sick beyond words. The scary part is they both ate different things and both got sick as a dog. Overall horrible outcome except for the great server .

-LuWxpTW7ukPvi67X8oF5Q.text: When you sit at the stoplight in front of Sharp Edge Creekhouse in Crafton and see HAPPY HOUR HALF OFF BELGIAN DRAFTS scrolling across their neon marquee, consider it a homing beacon that is (and should be) completely impossible to ignore.  Just sit at the bar that looks like it could be located on an Alpine Ski Slope & sample some truly amazing Belgian beers. The bartenders will be happy to educate you if you're a novice and let you sample until you've found something you'll love.  Personally, I fell hard for a Corsendonk Abbey Brown Ale that it turned out I could only afford if it was 1/2 off - cases of that stuff at Save on Beer run over $100!  But, it was a pure delight.   The happy hour was our 2nd stop at Sharp Edge. We'd done lunch and beers there previously with a less happy experience than our happy hour. The only things memorable about our lunch was that it was underwhelming on flavor and service and our bill seemed too high for the experience. We'd each had 2 beers with lunch and I guess at regular pricing those can add up quicker than we thought. Plus we didn't sit at the bar to receive the bartender's guidance in our selections and that's really one of the best things they do there.  Lesson: Don't pass up happy hour & make sure you sit at the bar. Not bad advice, in general!

dreDltS98s7vvYK4yHIbFQ.text: I like the bar. Restaurant is overpriced. I do enjoy eating on the large deck during the warmer months, though.

vFR3QsxNISYgoCllLAhRUQ.text: Great place for a wide variety of beers. I went there last night with my girl friend. We will start with the good. The waitress was very attentive and never let the drinks become empty. She was very quick with getting the orders to us as well.  Unfortunately the order was put in wrong and was undercooked. Management came over very quickly to let me know they would put in the right order and it was on the house.  The experience I had there was good. For the manager and waitress to be as proactive as they were was refreshing in a society that isn't very customer focused.   I give them a lot of credit and will be back due to the manager and the waitress.

IcTZ3kwzdgKHg7tr-VN03A.text: Stopped in for a nightcap and had the Raspberryoska. It was a good drink but seemed slightly pricy at $14 (plus tip). Nice atmosphere and we had good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. RASPBERRYOSKA ... A variation on the caiprioska, with the addition of Russia&#39;s seasonal raspberry, featuring Tito&#39;s Vodka

HLj5vHnVFBh78sa032Xxkg.text: I gave this place two chances and both times failed. The reviews do not add up to my experience here. The burgers are nothing special and don't have flavor. I think you could get a better burger at any other bar around here. Maybe the quality of the meat is above standard.... I don't know. The flavor is far below my standard especially for the price. The beer list is indeed long but that won't keep me coming back. Their burgers are disappointing and their other items taste like typical frozen bar food.

QjPv7RH-sjKWx-s_PeYVYg.text: Food is pretty good and there really aren't many options in the area but it's not a good value. If you drink beer/alcohol it's not affordable. The beers are overpriced and the place is musty, dark, and dingy.

5QxYVMgqJF2NXaSWGy2veg.text: Amazing beer selection. Seriously. Not the crappy flavored microbrews you'll see. Quality man's stuff. The food was very good too. We had burgers: pork, buffalo and sirloin and I got to sample all three. Really good. Wished mine was a little more medium than well.  Just wanted to point out the exceptional service. The waitress was extremely knowledgeable about the beers and was so nice to us. Especially my daughter.

qoi83MM9n_8brfREYM4EUQ.text: Always a good time! We've even ventured out of the river (kayaking) and up the hill to stop in for a bite to eat and a draft beer.

MseIbPCU8Q6qEP9ANWOkBg.text: It's bar food, but it is bar food magnifique, and before I say anything else, I will thank Dan, a dear friend from way, way back and beer connoisseur for bringing Kay and I here prior to the magnificent Mastodon/Opeth/Ghost gig that occurred Sunday evening.  Let me also immediately knock off a star for the rubbery (frozen?) calamari that served as our appetizer.  After said letdown was cleared from the road, the rest of the meal became one glorious, top-down cruise, even for someone like myself who abstains from the demon alcohol.   If you've ever been to one of the Sharp Edge franchises or have had a gander at their menu, you know that I was in a burger Shangri-La.  I for one knew little about SE going in other than that they specialize in beer, but when Dan mentioned that they serve ostrich burgers...a tingle shot up my backbone and into my brain. I'd never even thought of sampling this warrior-bird before, let alone in ground meat form.   Now, the patty is not pure ostrich. Minced sirloin is mixed into the ostrich to keep it from being "gamey" I suppose and to add some fat to the proceedings. Caramelized red onion, black pepper, pepperjack cheese, and dijon mustard are included as well as the standard tomato, onion, lettuce, dill pickle chips (nice ones at that) but wait...ancho chile mayonnaise you say?  The addition of artichoke hearts was my wacky idea, and I ended the modifications right there. This burger had its specific build for a reason, so despite the customization options, I trusted the chef, for the most part.   Uhh...*stammering* I really don't know how to describe the meat.   In all seriousness, my mind is an empty, white room at this moment.   Well...*deep breath* I must make an attempt, no?   Lean, wild, fierce, alien, it was a cheetah whose DNA was spliced with that of a gamecock by a perversely martial genetic engineer, killed in a jousting match, put through a grinder, and grilled to a dead-on medium rare, which like the  artichoke hearts, was also my idea. I have finally learned of the ideal temperature for burger supremacy, and it is to know Canaan.   Ah, I forgot to mention the cushiony, luxuriously toasted Kaiser bun that made the entire burger possible. My thumbs left deep impressions in the bread when I first picked it up. Juices dripped from the burger onto the plate as if it was a freshly gashed and squeezed lemon. Yet the bread would not disintegrate despite its comforting flexility. Dan laughed approvingly, knowing instantly before I did, before I took bite one, that my decisions were borne of sheer gastronomic guile and a willingness to gamble, experiment.   Exotic proteins were tamed by both the sugared allium only to be riled by the acid of the mustard and riled again by the pepperjack and riled further by that gorgeous, vibrant orange aioli. Each chomp contained a lifetime's worth of flavors that I've only begun to paint a word portrait of and have failed miserably at.   It was to eat a burger from another world. To pass on it and simply opt for a standard sirloin would have been cowardly and tragic.   The Belgian Frites were a mass of deep-fried potato virtuosity. Crumbly and luminously flaxen of jacket, each tater stave revealed a muggy, downy core that indicated a mastery and passion for the preparation of french fries. These were not merely blanched, these were cooked, wholly.   And with that, my burger weekend had begun and ended winningly. I could have ended my meal then and there without regret, but I coveted, craved The Belgian Chocolate Pudding.   As the goblet of creamed cocoa iniquity was placed before me by our waitress Johanna, Dan stated, "Maaan, that ain't Swiss Miss out of a packet." Nor was it Jello. Bill Cosby would mosh, not dance, if he ate this.   Nor was it made by Hershey. Profoundly chocolatey, the Callebaut, imported from Belgium, made its presence known throughout the entirety of my mouth, telling me through telepathy--and this chocolate was as alive and darkened as the Venom symbiote--that I was enjoying superior chocolate, the finest in all the globe. A chocolatier, a specialist, concieved this chocolate, and the pudding, which must be classed as the greatest I have ever consumed, was merely a way to showcase it. Whoever crafted this pudding has reclaimed what has been corrupted by mass production, vending machines, and lunch hour. Not that they were at all necessary, but whipped cream, roasted almond shards, a raspberry sauce, and a pirouline, that most addictive of canned, cylindrical wafers (and I will eat a can of 'em), acted as swell embellishments.  Sometimes you just need to listen to people who care about you, who know you, and know what you love to eat in order to find a satisfying meal. After all, whatever did we do before Yelp?   P.S. Expert beer drinker Dan adored his beer. He also loves Church Brew Works. So to the snobs, I thumb my nose.   P.P.S. Kay's Curry Mussels were A-1. 'Nuff said.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Belgian Chocolate Pudding
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mussels
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beer!

VUpGE0n1mDmJxeqIjxArEw.text: Are you kidding me? There is so much potential for a classy, Belgian beer atmosphere here, but it appears that the owners are just out to make a dollar. Yes, they have happy hour specials, but that's the only time when Belgians are actually affordable, seeing as they charge between 9 and 12 dollars for a 10-12 oz. glass. They have late nite food specials as well, and the food is again, only worth it after 10 pm. The bites are served on a fiesta ware plate, bare and never cooked correctly, not done or overdone. They charge for ranch or blue cheese-really? No, let's talk about the service. COMPLETELY UNDERSTAFFED. ALL. THE. TIME. Believe me, I've not just been there a couple of times. This brings me back to the comment about the owners only wanting to make money. Sharpedge Creekhouse, you're doing it wrong.

xjpbU9aDkQYZzqG73ewEaQ.text: I was here late during a hockey game.  The staff was super helpful and nice even through the place was going nuts.  The food was nice, the beer list is quite good.

CEV4GhECVz14Z6szRX1wiQ.text: Another day another Sharp Edge.  I'd say this would tie with the Friendship location.  It's the same kind of feel, dark interior like a ski lodge/beer emporium.  You know the type...right?!  I love their Almond Cranberry Chicken Salad platter.  It comes with a huge helping of chicken salad, a huge helping of pita bread, tomatoes and apples.  I just love it.  I think I love it so much because it's so creamy with mayo.  Which is probably bad, but oh so good!  I haven't been to this area before, but it seemed like this was a prime choice considering there's not...many...other...choices around.  And get the salad, I promise, you won't regret it!

obH7sj9uwF2eVSFjvV7AMg.text: The first time I was here I had a Rueben it was small, minimal meat and wasn't very good. I just had the pizza, which is also small and overpriced, it tastes like it's just thin crust with plain tomato sauce dumped on and a lot of cheese. I do not recommend

oq9KKlkVkouywmLs--tIAg.text: He Said: Sharp Edge/Creekhouse is a mini-Mecca, especially for Belgian beer lovers.  The tap and bottle selection is well-worth the visit.  This was my third or fourth time coming here on a visit to Pitt and I'll be happy to come back any time.  In the past I've had mussels (yum!), burgers (yum!), and various apps (mostly yum!).  Good atmosphere, good service, good times.   She Said: He and I shared the California Fire burger and some french fries, and that ghost pepper cheese is really amazing. Our server was nice, knowledgeable, and efficient, and all five of us enjoyed our meals. He and I would like to come back, sit at the bar, and sample many more of the great beers on the menu.  Potty Points: No trip to the potty on this visit!

k3WsAiNYQtZ1_unJYeiyWQ.text: Based on beers and drinks alone this place would have more stars.  The Reuben sandwich was just ok, very basic. The Mediterranean nachos were good but the artichoke dip didn't seem fresh. I loved my husbands Belgian burger. I will get that the next time.   Great place for drinks and to hang out. Food was just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Reuben
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mediterranean nachos
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Belgian burger with sweet potato fries

fuyfG07FF3669zNl5sw2Nw.text: What a disappointment! This past Friday night, my girlfriend and I planned to stay close near home because of the harsh, cold weather we were having. -18 was the wind chill to be exact. Not ideal weather so we wanted to get a good, quick bite to eat and head in for the evening. The Creekhouse in Crafton dampened our plans.   Being that we have been to this location a few times before, we felt comfortable there and basically knew what we were looking for. Creekhouse is a 2 minute drive and we have been attempting to make this one of our local favorites! Somewhere that is close, has good food and decent service. We wanted that to be Sharp Edge, unfortunately it did not go as planned.   My GF ordered a crispy chicken sandwich that was advertised with avocado and bacon. I got the fish sandwich special, which came with sweet potato fries and I got cheese added to the order. When the food arrived, my fish was missing the cheese and my GF's sandwich was missing the bacon. Not a huge deal. Everyone makes mistakes, so we had the waitress fix this, and it was all good! Our waitress was kind and helpful for the most part.   Then, we asked for a check and it all went downhill from there. We had a gift card and a coupon we wanted to use. Our family knows how much we like supporting local businesses so they gifted us a coupon book and a gift card for Christmas! So after 3 checks were printed (obviously wrong) the waitress tells us that she charged our $50 gift card and there was $0.83 left on it. A huge red flag because we order two $10 sandwiches and 2 drinks! After we made the waitress aware of this, she then said the manager was coming out to resolve the issue. We waited 15 minutes for the manager! I know it was 15 because I timed it.   All in all we were at this Creekhouse location for 2 hours! I have never experienced such bad service at a so called place of business in my life! This takes the cake. We planned on having a quick fun bite to eat at a local place and this location ruined it! I wouldn't recommend eating here at all! The single worst part about our trip to the Creekhouse, was the manager offered 0 compensation! Nothing! I explained how they messed our order and he still did not apologize for anything! Even freakin' McDonalds would offer you a free drink if they messed up your order, not at Sharp Edge. He did nothing but allow two upset and disappointed customers to walk out the door.   My girlfriend and I still have $15 bucks remaining on our gift card, but I highly doubt will be revisiting a Creekhouse any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish Sandwich!
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spanakopita!
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bourbon &amp; Ginger.

AqOCEzBjxk90g3J1Dt_iUw.text: On a frigid Friday night there is nothing better to do than to stay local and eat some good food. This was exactly what my boyfriend and I planned to do by going to Sharp Edge Creekhouse tonight.  Having been here before, I had a fairly average impression but remembered the food being pretty tasty with slow-ish service. We ordered the spanakopita appetizer and two drinks and it took a few minutes longer than most, but was absolutely delicious.  We have a coupon book that includes a Creekhouse buy one get one sandwich, salad, or burger coupon up to $12 in value, so we both ordered sandwiches for dinner. I got a fried chicken avocado sandwich, and according to the menu it came with pesto sauce, avocado, bacon, and Swiss. When I got it, there was no bacon or Swiss but there was a big slice of American cheese on it.  My boyfriend ordered their fish sandwich and added a slice of cheese to it. We both subbed our side with sweet potato fries for $1 extra. His sandwich came with no cheese, and I'm thinking our waitress may have mistaken our order.   We got our check and asked for it to be split with drinks on one order and food on another. We waited and waited and our check finally came. The waitress said she took $12 off for our BOGO coupon but only took $6 off. I try to be patient, but this started to make us feel slightly disgruntled as service seemed to slow as the night went on.   We asked for a corrected check but we were overcharged by a significant amount. Again we waited a decent while, enough to make anyone a bit annoyed. Our waitress passed by several times looking past us with plates of food for other patrons. After nearly 15 additional minutes we asked to speak with a manager and were told he was working on our checks and that it was difficult to get separate checks.  The manager eventually came out and greeted us. He listened to my explanation of what had happened and gave us the receipt that reflected our horribly misconsTrued dining experience here. Unfortunately, I would not say I'd like to go here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried chicken avocado sandwich
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spanakopita app looking amazing

xed77CNIf49KF_ODtGogoA.text: French onion soup tasted as good as it looked.  Tried the Belgian burger which was ground lamb. Very tasty. Felt like I was eating a lamb lollipop.  Hubby had the wild boar meatloaf.  We were both surprised how good it was. Didn't care for the cucumber basil mojito; think I need to stick with the fruit ones. Just had to try the made from scratch Belgian chocolate pudding.  While it tasted good it doesn't strike me as pudding.  It comes out looking like a scoop of ice cream and is very thick.  Very sweet too. Hubby said the cheesecake tasted frozen and they put too much raspberry sauce on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

I6IfqD4dMHnV2Y4VB0xrIg.text: Great food, had a vegetarian burger and fresh cut fries for lunch. Huge selection of beers. Sharon was the best ! A hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZwcWt2wWkIQZ7MbLJd9H9w.text: This place is better known as the Sharp Edge Creekhouse. Like its sister restaurant downtown it has a full offering of food, bevies and drinks but without all those bottle shelves.  My girlfriend and I decided to settle here for a late lunch. She had a chicken panini sandwich that came with sweet potato fries. I had French onion soup and a chicken peanut salad that came with a peanut dressing.   The food was fair. Wasn't overly impressed but it was descent. Service was good and all our needs were met. My girlfriend did enjoy her sandwich and fries. The restaurant is located at the intersection leading into Crafton next to the Thornburg bridge.

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken peanut salad
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken panini and sweet potato fries
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French onion soup

M44ciwIZUqqx4ZGz8yJBbQ.text: Worst service.   Don't care about service.   They charged my card twice and yet to apologize.   In fact, they put the blame on my bank for holding funds, not on their server for charging my card twice.   Was supposed to hear back from Roy on Thursday, never got a call back.   Called yesterday and talked to Nate (a manger) who cannot do anything without the boss's review.   All I want is my money back.    Terrible people.  Own up to your mistake.  Wouldn't even give them 1 star but had to select something to post the review.

4SiuJG-RzgRUswYYxwKMWw.text: This has been a family favorite for many years. Beer selection is fantastic. THE place in Pgh for Belgians. Don't miss the Buffalo Bites! Some menu items can be a little over-priced, but the food is very good.

_X0BGS2MDzv22iEh4AZCEg.text: Came here tonight with a group from work for happy hour. I hoped I would find a selection of local draft beers to choose from, and I did and selected one from East End brewing.  While talking with coworkers about stupid office stuff that seems so important to us but completely nonsensical to our beloved family members (hence the need for a work group happy hour), I noticed on the beer menu that they have Hacker Pschorr Hefe Weie  ON TAP!!!  At that point I knew I would be ordering another beer.  I could hardly wait, I think I may have guzzled my first beer so I could get to the Hacker Pschorr and enter nirvana.  Oh my gosh it was so smooth.  I see Sharp Edge has multiple locations - awesome!  I will be back with some of my beloved family members this weekend to enjoy this heavenly brew!

photos.caption: Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hacker-Pschorr weizen.  The fact they have this on tap guarantees a positive review!
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. East End Big Hop - very good taste!
Photo of Creekhouse - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gateway to the west! Who knew, I always thought St. Louis held that distinction!

gXAQvXioydFvc_C9s3UVUg.text: This is a pretty nice little place; the first thing that you will notice as you approach is the building, which sits well below Steuben.   There are 45 beers on draft, with 1/3 of those Belgians. The bartenders know the beers and will gladly give you a sample if you are debating your options.  The bar is small, but a lot of people can cram in, which gives it a warm and inviting feel.

wWkcf_jWlWJqMu2JqQ3dtQ.text: Great beers with a good menu. The Sharp Edge Creek house has a wide variety of beers on tap and even more to choose from in bottles.  The menu is good during the day, the burgers are fantastic and the pizza is solid as well, maybe a bit over priced.  They have a late night menu that has half priced items, including their "bites" (boneless chicken wings) that are my favorite. The Buffalo-Bleu sauce is great.

vBTFaSjP5hwM8dQ82NjLPw.text: I've lived a few minutes away from the Sharp Edge Creekhouse for almost 2 years, and have only visited here twice! To be honest, I always kind of forget that it exists because it sits on it own kind of hidden. "Creekhouse" is a great name for this location, because that is exactly what it resembles on the inside & outside!   Both times that I went to the Creekhouse, we were seated in the downstairs restaurant area. The atmosphere inside is just OK- as many others have said it has a bit of a lodge-y type feel. It could use some updating in my opinion, but there is something about it that is very charming. Everyone who works here also seems to be very nice & the service was pretty fast! This is a great place to come if you love beer. They have a ton of beers on tap- I am not much of a beer connoisseur- so I asked the waitress to help me choose one based off of what I liked. I forget the name of the beer she suggested but it was blueberry flavors & delicious. Chris also ordered an IPA that he didn't love too much.   For our meal, we were craving wings so we started out with the buffalo bleu wings. I am not too much of a blue cheese dressing kinda gal, but these wings might have converted me! I wish we would have gotten another flavor wing as well! For dinner, I ordered the grilled chicken & avocado sandwich with the arugula creaser salad as my side. This was just OK for me- nothing really special about it & probably something I could have made at home. Chris ordered the shrimp salad for his dinner- which was also just OK. The dressing was a citrus vinaigrette and it was sooo tangy! I am sure we will be back to visit Creekhouse while we still live in the neighborhood, but it wouldn't be a place that I would go completely out of my way to eat at.

DeFfdGBYyT3Xa5SaiyYc5w.text: This is a very nice place for beer drinking, watching games, and dining. I came here is the late afternoon and sat at the bar. The bar area is nice and cosy and the bartender was friendly and knowledgeable. They have a really good list of craft beers and some really good specials. During Pirates games you get a special price on a local ale, and prices in happy hour are half off on all craft beers and Belgians. I got a really good IPA and a porter along with the local ale that you get the special on during Pirates games.   I had the chicken avocado sandwich, which was really good and comes with fresh cut fries--you could tell they were cut from fresh potatoes and not frozen--they were really good.   There was a well placed screen playing the Pirates game, and they had good audio from the game playing.   This is really a nice place for a beer drinker and to have a good meal.

x6CO401yuGFZLD14i_PShw.text: Stopped in Sunday afternoon for a late lunch and was pleasantly surprised. My roommate that used to live nearby talks about this place and their chicken salad sandwich regularly and as others have mentioned, options for dining in the area are pretty limited. I was craving a burger/bar food and thought it would be the perfect opportunity.  It sits by itself and looks like a house-turned-restaurant. When we walked in, it was cozy and lodge-ish - not modern or fancy, and there was a small dining room plus a bar behind it.  I believe there is an upstairs as well, although we didn't see it.  We were seated quickly at a booth next to the bar where we could see they had a lot of beers on tap.  The happy hour special was running from 2-4 and included half price drafts and $.55 wings.  Bobby got a Southern Tier and we ordered a dozen wings - 6 in the buffalo bleu sauce and 6 of the dry Cajun rub. They came out crispy as we'd requested and were soooooo good. The buffalo bleu was my favorite!!!  I ordered the salmon Caesar salad albeit wanting to stuff my face with a burger, and of course, Bobby chose the build-your-own burger and loved it.  My salad was good. Standard lettuce, cheese, no croutons and salmon.... but I would definitely opt for one of their sandwiches next time.  Creekhouse got the W from Bobby and I would certainly come back if we are nearby in the future.   Service was good and atmosphere was pleasant (moreso when the rowdy group next to us left) and I like that they offer 'happy hour' specials on the weekend.  Definitely a place to check out if you're looking for good bar food, decent prices and a variety of beers.

It4DS89Fq26NycIDby6w_Q.text: Went here yesterday. It's so close to where we moved to so thought we should definitely get it a try. First off the decor and the building is so nice. I love old buildings. Huge beer selection, get the mystery one. For the price you can't beat it. I had the bison burger and french onion soup. The soup was cheesy and oniony perfect flavors. The burger was good. It wasn't anything special but because of the location, atmosphere, and the food, I would come here again. Plus a huge selection of beer.

tHsA0kg5C2tjM67qcw7gLg.text: We really enjoyed the OTE muscles.   My wife had the Reuben sandwich and she said she said better.

NUbvNlMOuP8TnwN9hZ8Dtg.text: I love all of the Sharp Edge locations but this is by far my favourite. My friends and I always have the best time when we meet up here. The beer selection is one of the biggest and best around. The owners have done a spectacular job with this local chain. Great food and snacks. The bites go well with just about any beer. Nice deck for drinking a proper pint on a warm summer evening.

UFKjZMMFoDqFCT-RP2F0xg.text: Had the buffalo blue wings .. good if you love blue cheese .. and the molten lava flavor (sirachia) were ok and hot.   Nice craft/Belgium beer selection.   Rueben sandwich was ok .. cole slaw was bland.    If you are a mussel lover.. several appetizer variations on the menu.    The beer is pricey but sometimes itworth it I guess. Will I go back? maybe..to try something else on the menu and check out some other beer but right after payday .. no doubt.

a0KpbuCck-bgPkMz2aApKg.text: Although I live a few blocks away and eat out often, I rarely go the the Sharp Edge Creekhouse anymore. It used to be a favorite, but it seems like both the food and the service slip every time I go there. Today was no exception. Had something from the Octoberfest menu. The pork was ok, but drowned in the sauerkraut which was not the way I'd wanted the meal. Why wouldn't that be served separate?  The spaetzle was tasteless. The order took forever for a hot table dish and some potato pancakes. Not worth the price and I had to wander the restaurant looking for anyone to refill our drinks.   My lunch companion had suggested it and I don't believe either of us will return.   Please fix this restaurant. I eat at the other Sharp Edge locations more than the one down the street. Update the menu and fix the service. Please.
